function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Association between indoor and outdoor green features and self-reported change in psychological outcomes related to the COVID-19 lockdown","Impact":"Lack of understanding the impact of indoor and outdoor green features on mental health and well-being during the COVID-19 pandemic","Mitigation":"Further studies to investigate the specific impact and benefits of indoor and outdoor green features on mental health and well-being","Technologies":"Research methods for assessing the impact of indoor and outdoor green features on mental health","People":"Individuals at risk of mental health issues during the COVID-19 lockdown","Owner":"Researchers and experts in the field of mental health and environment"},{"Description":"Need for further investigation into the definition and significance of indoor greenery for human health and well-being","Impact":"Limited understanding of the specific requirements for indoor greenery to have a significant impact on human health and well-being","Mitigation":"Conduct research to define the specific characteristics and quantity of indoor greenery needed for positive effects on human health and well-being","Technologies":"Surveys, studies, and environmental monitoring tools to assess the impact of indoor greenery on human health","People":"Individuals and communities seeking to improve mental health and well-being through indoor greenery","Owner":"Researchers and environmental health experts"},{"Description":"Investigation of the therapeutic benefits of indoor horticultural activities for individuals at risk, such as those with age-related diseases","Impact":"Limited understanding of the effectiveness of indoor horticultural activities as therapeutic tools for vulnerable populations","Mitigation":"Conduct studies to determine the therapeutic benefits and best practices of indoor horticultural activities for individuals at risk, such as those with age-related diseases","Technologies":"Research methods, surveys, and monitoring tools to assess the therapeutic benefits of indoor horticultural activities","People":"Individuals with age-related diseases and vulnerable populations","Owner":"Healthcare professionals and researchers in the field of horticultural therapy"}]}
